challenge.name: Crontab Conundrum
challenge.description: Using `185-oh-my-lord`, I tried scheduling my morning coffee in crontab, but it seems like I've scheduled a flag instead! Can you find it?

hints.content: Check the crontab entries; they can hold more than just schedules!

challenge.name: Suspicious User Snoop
challenge.description: Using `185-oh-my-lord`, I found a user suspicious user in the system... sounds like a spy! What's he hiding?

hints.content: Check `/etc/passwd` to find our furry friend and their secrets!

challenge.name: Logfile Mystery
challenge.description: Using `185-oh-my-lord`, Logs tell tales, but this one’s hiding a flag! Can you sift through the secrets?

hints.content: Logs can be more revealing than gossip—dig in!

challenge.name: Persistent Process Puzzle
challenge.description: Using `185-oh-my-lord`, There’s a mysterious background process running. Can you figure out what it’s up to and find the flag?

hints.content: Check the running processes—it might have something to say!

challenge.name: Using `185-oh-my-lord`, C Code Chaos
challenge.description: Can you compile this C program and find the hidden flag? Don’t forget to keep your compiler handy!

hints.content: You’ll need to compile the code before running it. Try `gcc`!

challenge.name: Using `185-oh-my-lord`, Secret Environment
challenge.description: There's a flag hiding in the environment variables! Can you find it without losing your sanity?

hints.content: Environment variables can be sneaky. Don’t overlook them!
